Comments
Lots of options.
Those willing to put in the hard work and effort.
St. Pat's is what the school is known for.
At the end of your career at school it is a shock if you don't have a job lined up before you graduate.
There are a lot of clubs to chose from. Everyone will be able to find a club they are interested in.
Lots of options of where to eat on campus.
It feels like a family sometimes.
It is tough be if you work at it you will succeed.
Be ready for hard work. Always do your homework. Show up for class. You will get out what you put in.
The professors really want their students to succeed. There are study sessions set up to help with understanding. You will not be left alone to make it out on your own.
pageTitle: Missouri University of Science and Technology (MST) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {299369=With the guy to girl ratio around 6:1, there are about 3 sororities and about 18 fraternities. Greek life is very social and active around campus. Many Greeks help out with volunteer work and other activities outside of their house. Greek housing can range from very ornate to run-down depending on different chapters., 317894=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 13690=Engineers. This school gives you the knowledge to be successful in whichever area you're interested in. And the have quite a lot of engineering departments. Nerds. Hard workers. Team players. Hands-on learners. Boy to Girl ration - 5:1 - Ladies, must I say anymore?, 112568=There are a lot more guys than girls at this university. Freshmen and Sophomores are ~3:2, after that age group, the ratio drops to ~4:1., 202016=I have visted S&T during one of there miner days and plan to attend Fall of 2013. I'm so excited about going to this school. I love the student body size and the courses offered., 31155=I enjoy MS&T for the most part, but there are a few things that aren't so great about it. The work load seems to really build up sometimes and the Male to Female ratio is 3:1 to name a few. Things like the annual St. Pat's celebration always make up for stuff like that though.}

textAfterTable: Am learning a lot In the math class I took, I learned an interesting learning style; the math I'd had before in High School (like in a summary) but I learned how to make things stick very well in MS&T's math class. My focus is in Computer Science. While I've had programming experience before, the pace of the class is incredible and by the end of Semester One we are now pretty much at the extent of my knowledge. So, given the pace we were at, I expect to learn a lot Semester Two. Login to rate or flag the reviews Benjamin from Rolla, MO 07/26/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 12 out of 12 people found this review useful. 3 of 79 Categories Comments Great for these types of students If you're a science geek, math geek, computer geek you'll LOVE Rolla. Among the most popular extracurricular activities here are student design teams. These are teams of students that build engineering marvels: solar cars, solar houses, F1 racing cars, fast
